recipe.ingredients: - firm tofu: 14 ounces - broccoli florets: 2 cups - carrot (sliced): 1 medium - bell pepper (sliced): 1 medium - onion (sliced): 1 small - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - soy sauce: 2 tablespoons - sesame oil: 1 tablespoon - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - cornstarch: 1 teaspoon - water: 2 tablespoons - green onions (chopped, for garnish): 2 - sesame seeds (for garnish): 1 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Press Tofu: Wrap the tofu in a clean kitchen towel and place a heavy object on top. Leave it for about 15-20 minutes to press out excess moisture. 2. Prepare Tofu: Cut the pressed tofu into cubes. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth. Toss the tofu cubes in the cornstarch mixture. 3. Cook Tofu: In a large skillet or wok, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes and stir-fry until golden and crispy. Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside. 4. Stir-Fry Vegetables: In the same skillet, add a bit more oil if needed. Add garlic, onion, and carrots, and stir-fry for about 2 minutes. Add broccoli and bell pepper, continue to stir-fry until vegetables are tender but still crisp. 5. Combine Ingredients: Return the tofu to the skillet. Add soy sauce and sesame oil, stir well to coat everything evenly. 6. Garnish and Serve: Sprinkle with chopped green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
